nodes.bodyText: shouldn't this be "the module you want to delete." ?

nodes.bodyText:
It'd be nice to have a conclusion after the procedure, such as "The deleted module is no longer available in {ProductShortName}, or some such.
Also, I'm curious to know whether the module simply gets unlisted from Pantheon or does it get deleted from the Git repository, This could be out of scope for the moment though.

nodes.bodyText: For consistency, I suggest using hyphen instead of underscore as the word separator, other than before {context}

s / "Deleteing" / "Deleting"
Also, I wonder how strict is the guidance for filename, id and heading to be similar in Pv2. If it is strict, the id should be changed to id="deleting-a-module-in-pantheon_{context}" and the file name proc_deleting-a-module-in-pantheon.adoc. @adahms is this something we should take care of now, or should we do this once the Pv2 rules are finalized?
would it be better to just say "Select the module you want to delete"?

nodes.bodyText:
I think with short simple procedures like delete, add, import etc.,
we don't need to add extra text explaining the motivation.

nodes.bodyText:
As this is not a step, I suggest not having it as a list item. Perhaps it could be aligned with the last step as
. In the confirmation screen, click OK to confirm.
+
The module is deleted and is no longer available in the Modules tab.
Or,
as a standalone statement
. In the confirmation screen, click OK to confirm.
The module is deleted and is no longer available in the Modules tab.
The latter structure would serve as the result for the module - I prefer this!

nodes.bodyText: Is Modules tab the correct UI element name? Or maybe it should be the Search page?
